alert.note: Alert for Broward; Miami-Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 03 at 3:05PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of South Florida, including the following counties, Broward and Miami-Dade. * WHEN...Until 615 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 304 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to training of showers and a few thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen with these showers and thundestorms during the last hour. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area with these training showers and thunderstorms. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. If the rainfall amounts increase more than forecast, then a Flash Flood Warning may be needed for this area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Lauderdale, Hollywood, Pompano Beach, Davie, Deerfield Beach, Tamarac, Margate, Lighthouse Point, Lauderdale-By-The- Sea, Surfside, Hallandale, Miami Gardens, Lauderhill, North Miami, Coconut Creek, North Miami Beach, Oakland Park, Aventura, Lauderdale Lakes and Dania Beach. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report flooding to your local law enforcement agency when you can do so safely.
